wisdom.sentence: Linux machine! because a 486 is a terrible thing to waste!

wisdom.sentence: "A word to the wise: a credentials dicksize war is usually a bad idea on the net."
wisdom.author: David Parsons in c.o.l.development.system, about coding in C.

wisdom.sentence: "Absolutely nothing should be concluded from these figures except that no conclusion can be drawn from them."
wisdom.author: Joseph L. Brothers, Linux/PowerPC Project

wisdom.sentence: "All language designers are arrogant.  Goes with the territory..."
wisdom.author: Larry Wall

wisdom.sentence: And 1.1.81 is officially BugFree(tm), so if you receive any bug-reports on it, you know they are just evil lies."
wisdom.author: Linus Torvalds, Linus.Torvalds@cs.helsinki.fi

wisdom.sentence: "...and scantily clad females, of course.  Who cares if it's below zero outside"
wisdom.author: Linus Torvalds

wisdom.sentence: "Are [Linux users] lemmings collectively jumping off of the cliff of reliable, well-engineered commercial software?"
wisdom.author: Matt Welsh

wisdom.sentence: As usual, this being a 1.3.x release, I haven't even compiled this kernel yet.  So if it works, you should be doubly impressed.
wisdom.author: Linus Torvalds, announcing kernel 1.3.3 on the linux-kernel mailing list

wisdom.sentence: Avoid the Gates of Hell.  Use Linux.
Be warned that typing  Bkillall  Iname P may not have the desired effect on non-Linux systems, especially when done by a privileged user.
wisdom.author: From the killall manual page

wisdom.sentence: "Besides, I think [Slackware] sounds better than 'Microsoft,' don't you?"
wisdom.author: Patrick Volkerding

wisdom.sentence: But what can you do with it?  -- ubiquitous cry from Linux-user partner.
wisdom.author: Andy Pearce, ajp@hpopd.pwd.hp.com

wisdom.sentence: "By golly, I'm beginning to think Linux really *is* the best thing since sliced bread."
wisdom.author: Vance Petree, Virginia Power

wisdom.sentence: "...Deep Hack Mode--that mysterious and frightening state of consciousness where Mortal Users fear to tread."
wisdom.author: Matt Welsh

wisdom.sentence: Dijkstra probably hates me.
wisdom.author: Linus Torvalds, in kernel/sched.c

wisdom.sentence: "Even more amazing was the realization that God has Internet access.  I wonder if He has a full newsfeed?"
wisdom.author: Matt Welsh

wisdom.sentence: >Ever heard of .cshrc? That's a city in Bosnia.  Right?
wisdom.author: Discussion in comp.os.linux.misc on the intuitiveness of commands

wisdom.sentence: Fatal Error: Found [MS-Windows] System -> Repartitioning Disk for Linux...
wisdom.author: cbbrown@io.org, Christopher Browne

wisdom.sentence: How do I type "for i in *.dvi do xdvi i done" in a GUI?
wisdom.author: Discussion in comp.os.linux.misc on the intuitiveness of interfaces

wisdom.sentence: "How should I know if it works? That's what beta testers are for.  I only coded it."
wisdom.author: Attributed to Linus Torvalds

wisdom.sentence: I develop for Linux for a living, I used to develop for DOS. Going from DOS to Linux is like trading a glider for an F117.
wisdom.author: entropy@world.std.com, Lawrence Foard

wisdom.sentence: I did this 'cause Linux gives me a woody.  It doesn't generate revenue.
wisdom.author: Dave '-ddt->` Taylor, announcing DOOM for Linux

wisdom.sentence: Feel free to contact me (flames about my english and the useless of this driver will be redirected to /dev/null, oh no, it's full...).
wisdom.author: Michael Beck, describing the PC-speaker sound device

wisdom.sentence: "I once witnessed a long-winded, month-long flamewar over the use of mice vs. trackballs...It was very silly."
wisdom.author: Matt Welsh

wisdom.sentence: "I would rather spend 10 hours reading someone else's source code than 10 minutes listening to Musak waiting for technical support which isn't."
wisdom.author: Dr. Greg Wettstein, Roger Maris Cancer Center

wisdom.sentence: "I'd crawl over an acre of 'Visual This++' and 'Integrated Development That' to get to gcc, Emacs, and gdb.  Thank you."
wisdom.author: Vance Petree, Virginia Power

wisdom.sentence: I've run DOOM more in the last few days than I have the last few months. I just love debugging ;-)
wisdom.author: Linus Torvalds

wisdom.sentence: "If the future navigation system [for interactive networked services on the NII] looks like something from Microsoft, it will never work."
wisdom.author: Chairman of Walt Disney Television & Telecommunications

wisdom.sentence: "If you want to travel around the world and be invited to speak at a lot of different places, just write a Unix operating system."
wisdom.author: Linus Torvalds

wisdom.sentence: In most countries selling harmful things like drugs is punishable. Then howcome people can sell Microsoft software and go unpunished?
wisdom.author: hasku@rost.abo.fi, Hasse Skrifvars

wisdom.sentence: Intel engineering seem to have misheard Intel marketing strategy. The phrase was "Divide and conquer" not "Divide and cock up"
wisdom.author: iialan@www.linux.org.uk, Alan Cox

wisdom.sentence: "It's God.  No, not Richard Stallman, or Linus Torvalds, but God."
wisdom.author: Matt Welsh

wisdom.sentence: LILO, you've got me on my knees!
wisdom.author: David Black, dblack@pilot.njin.net, with apologies to Derek and the Dominos, and Werner Almsberger

wisdom.sentence: Linux is obsolete.
wisdom.author: Andrew Tanenbaum

wisdom.sentence: "Linux poses a real challenge for those with a taste for late-night hacking (and/or conversations with God)."
wisdom.author: Matt Welsh

wisdom.sentence: Linux!Guerrilla UNIX Development     Venimus, Vidimus, Dolavimus.
wisdom.author: mah@ka4ybr.com, Mark A. Horton KA4YBR

wisdom.sentence: "...[Linux's] capacity to talk via any medium except smoke signals."

wisdom.sentence: linux: because a PC is a terrible thing to waste.

wisdom.sentence: Linux: Because a PC is a terrible thing to waste.

wisdom.author: ksh@cis.ufl.edu put this on Tshirts in '93

wisdom.sentence: "Linux: the operating system with a CLUE... Command Line User Environment".

wisdom.sentence: lp1 on fire.
wisdom.author: One of the more obfuscated kernel messages

wisdom.sentence: "MSDOS didn't get as bad as it is overnight -- it took over ten years of careful development."
wisdom.author: dmeggins@aix1.uottawa.ca

wisdom.sentence: "Never make any mistaeks."
wisdom.author: Anonymous, in a mail discussion about to a kernel bug report

wisdom.sentence: > No manual is ever necessary. May I politely interject here: BULLSHIT.  That's the biggest Apple lie of all!
wisdom.author: Discussion in comp.os.linux.misc on the intuitiveness of interfaces

wisdom.sentence: Not me, guy. I read the Bash man page each day like a Jehovah's Witness reads the Bible. No wait, the Bash man page IS the bible. Excuse me...
wisdom.author: Taken from comp.os.linux.misc

wisdom.sentence: "Oh, I've seen copies [of Linux Journal] around the terminal room at The Labs."
wisdom.author: Dennis Ritchie

wisdom.sentence: "On a normal ascii line, the only safe condition to detect is a 'BREAK' - everything else having been assigned functions by Gnu EMACS."
wisdom.author: Tarl Neustaedter

wisdom.sentence: "On the Internet, no one knows you're using Windows NT"
wisdom.author: Ramiro Estrugo, restrugo@fateware.com

wisdom.sentence: There are no threads in a.b.p.erotica, so there's no  gain in using a threaded news reader.
"Problem solving under linux has never been the circus that it is under AIX."
wisdom.author: Pete Ehlke in comp.unix.aix

wisdom.sentence: Running Windows on a Pentium is like having a brand new Porsche but only be able to drive backwards with the handbrake on.
"sic transit discus mundi"
wisdom.author: From the System Administrator's Guide, by Lars Wirzenius

wisdom.sentence: Sigh.  I like to think it's just the Linux people who want to be on the "leading edge" so bad they walk right off the precipice.
wisdom.author: Craig E. Groeschel

wisdom.sentence: The chat program is in public domain. This is not the GNU public license. If it breaks then you get to keep both pieces.
wisdom.author: Copyright notice for the chat program

wisdom.sentence: The nice thing about Windows is - It does not just crash, it displays a dialog box and lets you press 'OK' first.
wisdom.author: Arno Schaefer's .sig

wisdom.sentence: The only "intuitive" interface is the nipple. After that, it's all learned.
wisdom.author: Bruce Ediger, bediger@teal.csn.org, in comp.os.linux.misc, on X interfaces.

wisdom.sentence: There are two types of Linux developers - those who can spell, and those who can't. There is a constant pitched battle between the two.
wisdom.author: From one of the post-1.1.54 kernel update messages posted to c.o.l.a

wisdom.sentence: "...Unix, MS-DOS, and Windows NT (also known as the Good, the Bad, and the Ugly)."
wisdom.author: Matt Welsh

wisdom.sentence: "We all know Linux is great...it does infinite loops in 5 seconds."
wisdom.author: Linus Torvalds about the superiority of Linux on the Amterdam Linux Symposium

wisdom.sentence: We are MicroSoft.  You will be assimilated.  Resistance is futile.
wisdom.author: Attributed to B.G., Gill Bates

wisdom.sentence: We are Pentium of Borg. Division is futile. You will be approximated.
We are using Linux daily to UP our productivity - so UP yours!
wisdom.author: Adapted from Pat Paulsen by Joe Sloan

wisdom.sentence: We come to bury DOS, not to praise it.
wisdom.author: Paul Vojta, vojta@math.berkeley.edu, paraphrasing a quote of Shakespeare

wisdom.sentence: We use Linux for all our mission-critical applications. Having the source code means that we are not held hostage by anyone's support department.
wisdom.author: Russell Nelson, President of Crynwr Software

wisdom.sentence: `When you say "I wrote a program that crashed Windows", people just stare at you blankly and say "Hey, I got those with the system, *for free*".'
wisdom.author: Linus Torvalds

wisdom.sentence: "Whip me.  Beat me.  Make me maintain AIX."
wisdom.author: Stephan Zielinski

wisdom.sentence: "Who is General Failure and why is he reading my hard disk ?" Microsoft spel chekar vor sail, worgs grate !!
wisdom.author: leitner@inf.fu-berlin.de, Felix von Leitner

wisdom.sentence: Why use Windows, since there is a door?
wisdom.author: fachat@galileo.rhein-neckar.de, Andre Fachat

wisdom.sentence: "World domination.  Fast"
wisdom.author: Linus Torvalds

wisdom.sentence: ..you could spend *all day* customizing the title bar.Believe me.  I speak from experience."
wisdom.author: Matt Welsh

wisdom.sentence: Your job is being a professor and researcher: That's one hell of a good excuse for some of the brain-damages of minix.
wisdom.author: Linus Torvalds to Andrew Tanenbaum
